methods.javadoc:
Get a standard Java authenticator for HTTP and other standard network connections
@return authenticator object
methods.name: getAuthenticator
methods.comment: Get a standard Java authenticator for HTTP and other standard network connections

methods.name: processPasswordCallbacks
methods.comment: Process Ghidra Server password authentication callbacks.

params.name: title
params.comment: password prompt title if GUI is used

params.name: serverType
params.comment: type of server (label associated with serverName)

params.name: nameCb
params.comment:
provides storage for user login name.  A null indicates
 that the default user name will be used, @see ClientUtil#getUserName().

params.name: passCb
params.comment: provides storage for user password, @see PasswordCallback#setPassword(char[])

params.name: choiceCb
params.comment:
specifies choice between NT Domain authentication (index=0) and local password
 file authentication (index=1).  Set selected index to specify authenticator to be used,

params.name: anonymousCb
params.comment:
may be used to request anonymous read-only access to 
 the server.  A null is specified if anonymous access has not been enabed on the server.

params.name: loginError
params.comment: previous login error message or null for first attempt

methods.name: promptForReconnect

params.name: parent
params.comment: dialog parent component or null if not applicable

return.comment: return true if reconnect should be attempted

methods.name: getNewPassword

params.name: parent
params.comment: dialog parent component or null if not applicable

return.comment:
new password or null if password should not be changed, 
 if not null array will be cleared by caller

methods.javadoc: @return true if SSH private key is available for authentication
methods.name: isSSHKeyAvailable

return.comment: true if SSH private key is available for authentication

methods.name: processSSHSignatureCallbacks
methods.comment: Process Ghidra Server SSH authentication callbacks.

params.name: nameCb
params.comment:
provides storage for user login name.  A null indicates
 that the default user name will be used, @see ClientUtil#getUserName().

params.name: sshCb
params.comment: provides authentication token to be signed with private key, @see SSHAuthenticationCallback#sign(SSHPrivateKey)
